qas.question: What changes impressed Gaddafi in Egypt?

answers.text: President Gamal Abdel Nasser. Nasser argued for Arab nationalism; the rejection of Western colonialism, neo-colonialism, and Zionism
his hero, President Gamal Abdel Nasser

qas.question: What book instructed Gaddafi in how to stage a coup?

answers.text: Nasser's book, Philosophy of the Revolution

qas.question: Name one event that occurred in the Arab world during Gaddafi 's childhood that influenced his life.

answers.text: 1948 Arab–Israeli War, the Egyptian Revolution of 1952, the Suez Crisis of 1956, and the short-lived existence of the United Arab Republic between 1958 and 1961

qas.question: What political ideology did Nasser implement?
What was the nationality of a significant number of teachers in Sabha?
From what city did Voice of the Arabs broadcast?
When did the United Arab Republic end?
What political leader did Gaddafi greatly admire?

context: Many teachers at Sabha were <a5_0>Egyptian<a5_0/>, and for the first time Gaddafi had access to pan-Arab newspapers and radio broadcasts, most notably the <a6_0>Cairo<a6_0/>-based Voice of the Arabs. Growing up, Gaddafi witnessed significant events rock the Arab world, including the <a3_0>1948 Arab–Israeli War, the <a7_0>Egyptian Revolution<a7_0/> of 1952, the Suez Crisis of 1956, and the short-lived existence of the United Arab Republic between 1958 and <a8_0>1961<a8_0/><a3_0/>. Gaddafi admired the political changes implemented in the Arab Republic of Egypt under <a1_0>his hero, <a0_0>President Gamal Abdel <a9_0>Nasser<a9_0/><a1_0/>. Nasser argued for Arab nationalism; the rejection of Western colonialism, neo-colonialism, and Zionism<a0_0/>; and a <a4_0>transition from capitalism to socialism<a4_0/>. <a2_0>Nasser's book, Philosophy of the Revolution<a2_0/>, was a key influence on Gaddafi; outlining how to initiate a coup, it has been described as "the inspiration and blueprint of [Gaddafi's] revolution."
